pros: Helpful programs for clients who are offered the chance to participate.
cons: Was terminated in a shocking meeting without notice, feedback nor opportunity to improve any unknown issue. I was dedicated, enthusiastic, and following the rules. I was passionate about the work. The union rep who was belatedly called in to witness the tail end of the surprise firing session told me privately that they agreed I had been treated unfairly and that this sort of surprise termination was common in the organization. I applied for the job not only because I was passionate about its purpose and mission, but I was recommended by existing staff, and because the stated values of the company perfectly matched my own. However, in my experience, the organization's actions did not at all match their stated values and ethics. The shock, mystery and feeling of devaluation of being terminated without notice or justifiable reason was devastating.

pros: I loved the fact that I met  hundreds of new people. I made over 200 new employer connections. Everyday was a new learning experience. I gained a great deal of experience working with specialized population groups and people with disabilities. Satisfaction of helping someone find their job was my true driver. Staff are super friendly and authentic. The work itself is flexable.  Having experience in this field can lead into for profit jobs in recruitment. Great experience for anyone who has a passion for helping people. Every single staff member is in this line of business because they authentically want to help their clients find jobs. Loved working here and will miss the team.
cons: Low pay! High partner staff turnover. Low incentives to hit targets and outcomes. Not a lot of technology or softwares used to enhance processes.

pros: Great co-workers, wonderful front-line staff
cons: Huge cutbacks, not enough staff to handle the unrealistic targets set upon staff. The attitude from the CEO on down is that they are happy to get 12-18 months out of people. They could care less who stays, who goes, you are replaceable. There is almost zero training, you never start your position with the tools or enough information to do your job effectively. Unless you are part of the "elite group:, no one cares what you do or if you leave for any reason. They ask you to do an Exit Interview yet don't really care about the information as nothing has changed in YEARS. NO APPRECIATION, NO SUPPORT! If you want to be just another number, work here.

pros:
ODG is filled with great people who believe in the work that they do. Our clients come from all walks of life, and we have the rare opportunity to learn their life stories and share in their successes.

At the same time, there are a lot of opportunities for advancement within the organization, and the organization is committed to providing ongoing training and professional development opportunities to everyone.
cons: ODG is a lean organization for its size, so there are a lot of opportunities to work on different projects and participate in different initiatives, but time tends to be at a premium and changes can happen quickly. This kind of dynamic work environment might not be for everyone.

review_title: Ensure you have the facts before making changes
pros: We have really good contracts from government to provide services to people with disabilities and barriers to work, training, and community connection.
cons: Management/leadership are so busy that they may not be fully in touch and informed about the front line issues and best solutions.  Lack of monitoring the work staff are doing and use hard facts and data to problem solve and correct - monitor and hold people accountable to the bottom line.
